entry.title: CivilNet sues Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan

media:group.media:title: CivilNet sues Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan
media:group.media:description:
üìç The likelihood of a large-scale Azerbaijani military attack on Armenia in 2025 is considered low, according to a report today by Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Intelligence Service. üìç In Davos, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan described Armenia as both interested in joining the European Union, but careful of maintaining a balance in relations with all its partners. üìç CivilNet has filed a cross claim against Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan, demanding a public apology from him for referring to the media in the country as ‚Äúa big garbage dump.‚Äù

entry.title: International silence over Azerbaijan's kangaroo courts

media:group.media:title: International silence over Azerbaijan's kangaroo courts
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian shines a spotlight on the deeply disturbing Stalinist-style show trials being staged by the Azerbaijani regime against Armenian hostages. Hacopian dissects the international community's muted response, the Armenian government's shameful silence, and the urgent need for a robust, multi-pronged strategy to confront this egregious violation of human rights. The episode also unpacks the significance of the recently signed US-Armenia strategic agreement, addressing misconceptions and underscoring its geopolitical implications.

entry.title: The new Myler ski resort gives a boost to Armenia‚Äôs rapidly growing winter sports scene #shorts

media:group.media:title: The new Myler ski resort gives a boost to Armenia‚Äôs rapidly growing winter sports scene #shorts
media:group.media:description:
2,000 meters above sea level, the village of Yeghipatrush in Armenia‚Äôs Aragatsotn region has the mountainous landscape and crisp fresh air that makes it perfect for winter sports enthusiasts. There the Myler ski resort is being created just for them.
Myler diversifies options for ski fans in Armenia, which had previously been centered on Tsaghkadzor, where Soviet-era Winter Olympians used to train. Now winter sports are really taking off.
